conversation.message: Hello School_E admissions committee—I'm Student_B and School_E is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I’m highly motivated to join your community and would commit enthusiastically if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.

Applying immediately maximizes my chance to secure my first choice before other students commit elsewhere. Even if Student_E applies, I’m still a top candidate, so it’s worth an early formal application.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Sincerely,

conversation.thought: As School_E, my true priority ranks Student_E highest, then Student_B, Student_A, Student_D, Student_C. In this round I received [APPLY] from Student_E, Student_B, Student_A, and Student_D, and I have quota 1. Since I can secure my top-choice (Student_E) right now, accepting Student_B would be suboptimal and would block me from matching with Student_E. Therefore I should reject Student_B this round to preserve the seat for the higher-priority applicant.
